str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and bibazo (by reduplication) of the base of basis); to drive together, i.e. Unite, to infer, show, teach.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From the base of pletho; wealth, i.e. money, possessions, or abundance, richness, valuable bestowment.
Full assurance, conviction, confidence. From plerophoreo; entire confidence.
From suniemi; a mental putting together, i.e. Intelligence or the intellect.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of muo; a secret or 'mystery'.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
